summary:
Video games are electronic games where players use controllers to interact with a visual display. They are played on various devices like computers, consoles, or mobile phones. Modern games often have colorful graphics, sounds, and sometimes even touch or motion features.

The first video games appeared in the 1970s, and the industry grew quickly. However, it faced a crash in the 1980s due to market oversaturation. After this, Japanese companies like Nintendo took the lead. In recent years, independent games ("indie games") have become popular.

The video game industry is huge, earning more money than music and films combined. It also influences technology, driving improvements in hardware.
title: Video game
